marketNews.title: The Fed Projects Fewer Rate Cuts in 2025
marketNews.content: The Federal Reserve cut its policy rate by 25 basis points to a range of 4.25-4.50% on Wednesday (19 Dec) local time, matching consensus expectations. This was the third cut of the year, bringing total cuts to 100 bps. The Fed, however, projected a smaller amount of rate cuts in 2025 because of a slower decline in inflation and caution over uncertainty surrounding the elected U.S. president, Donald Trump. The Fed now expects 2025 inflation to be 2.5%, higher than the previous 2.1% forecast, and therefore sees only 50 bps (two 25-bps cuts) of easing in 2025, down from the 100 bps projected in September 2024. In response, U.S. equity markets weakened and bond yields rose on Wednesday (18 Dec) local time: S&P 500 –2.95 %, Nasdaq –3.56 %, DJIA –2.65 %, DXY +1 %, UST 10-year +11.5 bps. Indonesian capital markets also weakened on the same day: the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 1.84 % while the 10-year government bond yield rose 43 bps to 7.10 %. The rupiah slipped 1.24 % to IDR 16,290 per dollar. Key takeaway: The Fed’s more modest rate-cut outlook may limit the space for Bank Indonesia to cut rates; Bloomberg’s consensus on Thursday (19 Dec) still projects a ~75 bps cut in 2025. In the current volatility, investors may consider buying higher-yielding government bonds, such as PBS032 (maturing in about 1.5 years) offering a 6.93 % yield on Thursday (19 Dec). Short-term government bonds have lower volatility than longer-term issues, especially given uncertainty over the timing and magnitude of future rate cuts.

marketNews.title: Bappenas Targets Investment 2025-2029
marketNews.content: The Ministry of National Development Planning/Bappenas announced that it targets Indonesia’s real GDP growth of 5.3 % in 2025, 6.3 % in 2026, 7.5 % in 2027, 7.7 % in 2028 and 8 % in 2029. These targets are well above the World Bank’s forecast of 5.1 % for 2025-2026 and 5 % for 2027, and above the IMF’s projection of a flat 5.1 % growth from 2025-2029. To achieve the targets, Bappenas aims to realise total investment of IDR 47 587,3 trillion over 2025-2029 (equivalent to IDR 9 517 trillion per year). For comparison, the government’s own 2025 investment target is IDR 1 906 trillion.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia to Purchase 150 Trillion IDR of Government Bonds in 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said on Wednesday (18 Dec) that the central bank will purchase IDR 150 trillion of Indonesian government bonds in the secondary market in 2025, with the amount potentially increasing. The planned purchase exceeds the IDR 100 trillion of 2025-maturing bonds that are part of a burden-sharing scheme between the government and the central bank to finance Covid-19-era liabilities.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia to Cooperate with KPK on CSR Investigation
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said on Wednesday (18 Dec) that the central bank will cooperate with the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) in the investigation of alleged misuse of corporate-social-responsibility (CSR) funds at the central bank. He said the market will monitor the case, which could affect market conditions and the exchange rate. The KPK conducted a raid on the central bank’s offices, including Warjiyo’s office, on Monday (16 Dec) as part of the probe into alleged CSR fund misuse.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Says He May Pardon Corruptors Who Return Stolen Funds
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto said on Wednesday (18 Dec) that he may pardon corrupt officials if they return the money they stole. He gave no details on the mechanism, only noting that the administration may provide a way for corruptors to return stolen assets quietly. The 2023 Transparency International Corruption Perceptions Index gave Indonesia a score of 34 out of 100, indicating serious corruption problems.

marketNews.title: U.S. President Donald Trump Rejects Bipartisan Budget, Risks U.S. Government Shutdown
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday (18 Dec) rejected a bipartisan spending bill being debated in Congress and demanded a higher debt ceiling before taking office next month. The rejected package, which included $100.4 billion in disaster aid, farm-relief assistance, funding to rebuild the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, and a pay raise for members of Congress, could trigger a U.S. government shutdown on Saturday (21 Dec), disrupting air travel and law-enforcement activities ahead of the Christmas holidays. If it occurs, it would be the first shutdown since late December 2018-early 2019, when Trump was in his first term. Trump warned that Republican lawmakers supporting the bipartisan bill would face electoral difficulties.

marketNews.title: ENAK Announces Voluntary Tender Offer
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance’s tender for a voluntary share offering of about 165.5 million (7.64 %) ENAK shares at IDR 1,025 per share – 16 % above the Thursday (19 Dec) price of IDR 880 – received OJK’s effective approval on 17 Dec 2024 after ENAK announced the corporate action in early August 2024. If the full offer is taken up, Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd.’s stake will rise from roughly 42.5 % to 50.1 %. The tender runs from 19 Dec 2024 to 17 Jan 2025, with payment on 30 Jan 2025.

marketNews.title: FITT Shareholder Jon Fieris Sells 50 Million Shares
marketNews.content: Shareholder Jon Fieris sold 50 million FITT shares at an average price of IDR 96 per share on 17 Dec 2024, a total transaction value of IDR 4.8 billion. After the sale, Jon Fieris’s ownership fell from 9.35 % to 5.52 %.

marketNews.title: RONY Announces Purchase of 80 % of Shares by Honour Accord
marketNews.content: Aesler Group International (ticker RONY) announced that Honour Accord Limited intends to purchase 1 billion (80 %) of the company’s shares from PT Nakula Investama Indonesia and PT Karimun Jawa Pratama, the current controlling shareholders. The transaction value was not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: BBRI Confirms Data and Funds Are Safe After Ransomware Allegations
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) director Arga M. Nugraha said that the bank’s data and customers’ funds remain safe despite reports of a ransomware attack. He said customers can continue to use all BBRI banking services normally. The statement followed a wave of X-platform posts claiming the bank had suffered a ransomware attack.

tickerNews.title: MDKA Posts 3Q 2024 Net Loss
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) reported a net loss of US$54.5 million in 3Q 2024 versus a net profit of US$2.7 million in 2Q 2024 and US$25.4 million in 3Q 2023. The 9-month loss totals US$67 million versus a 9-month profit of US$23.8 million in 2023, missing the FY 2024 consensus of a US$5.4 million loss. The decline was driven by gross-margin compression to 5.1 % in 3Q 24 (vs 2Q 24 10 %, 3Q 23 11.2 %) after mining-costs rose +42 % QoQ and +45 % YoY.

tickerNews.title: MBMA – Quarter-End 3Q 2024 Results
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials (MBMA) posted a 3Q 2024 net loss of US$1.9 million versus a 2Q 2024 net profit of US$16.7 million and 3Q 2023 profit of US$20.3 million. The 9-month profit was US$18.5 million versus US$677 thousand in 9M 2023, well below the FY 2024 consensus of US$35.3 million (52 % of estimate). The loss was driven by a sharp fall in gross margin to 3.5 % in 3Q 24 (vs 2Q 24 9.5 %, 3Q 23 8.2 %) as mining-costs rose +49 % QoQ and +197 % YoY.

tickerNews.title: KLBF Considers Increasing Pricing Due to Rupiah Weakness and PPN 12% Increase
